call_title: Machina Finance: eUTXO-Native P2P DEX on Ergo — Alison Robson (Ergo Meetup 2025)

decisions.decision: No protocol level fees for Machina
decisions.speaker: anon_BR
decisions.context: Reached decision after years of maturation that protocol level fees are not good for growth
decisions.quote: we reached to the decision that protocol level fees are not good for very good growth as a whole. So we just gave up on this and let's make a public good

decisions.decision: Hermes will replace GraphQL on Nautilus
decisions.speaker: anon_BR
decisions.context: GraphQL was acknowledged as a big mistake, Hermes will provide better user experience
decisions.quote: Hermes, we will replace GraphQL on Nautilus, so hopefully we have a way better user experience there

commitments.timeline: by the end of this year
commitments.quote: by the end of this year, I want to have Hermes fully functional
And Fleet SDK for Q1 of the next year. Oh, sorry, not Fleet SDK, but Machina SDK

commitments.commitment: Have full end-to-end beta on Mainnet
commitments.quote: on Q2, our plan is to have our full end-to-end beta on Mainnet

reversals_or_updates.update: GraphQL acknowledged as a big mistake
reversals_or_updates.reason: It was not successful despite being built to make Ergo work properly
reversals_or_updates.speaker: anon_BR

key_facts.fact: Biggest grid contract is around 300 bytes, allowing 219 orders in a single transaction
key_facts.speaker: anon_BR

key_facts.fact: Maximum block size is 1.27 million bytes (1,270 kilobytes)
key_facts.speaker: mgPai

key_facts.fact: Can do about 3750 orders per block (worst case)
key_facts.speaker: mgPai

key_facts.fact: Best case is 16,000 transactions per block
key_facts.speaker: anon_BR
